result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leila Onofre Horowitz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Leila Onofre Horowitz in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached, joint recommendation, argue jail.  16CF17 Count 1 DAGPA; Counts 3 & 4 2 yrs. probation; Counts 2 & 5 dismiss; 16CF20 dismiss; 2 traffic citations, plead to guidelines @ .12-.149.  Court advises defendant of charges in count 3 & 4/max. penalties; count 1/max penalties; advised of felony prohibitions; review DPA. Defendant pleads guilty to OWI; pleads guilty to Count 3; guilty to Count 4; subject to DPA in Count 1 pleads guilty.  Plea Colloquy. Court advises defendant of criminal conviction can result in immigration consequences.  Court finds defendant's waiver of her constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty of OWI; Count 3, Count 4, approve DPA in Count 1; dismiss but consider as read-in 16CF20; withhold sentence and place on 2 yrs probation with conditions; OWI assess $937.50; 6 mos. revoc.; AA/DSP; stipulate refusal reasonable and dismiss; Advised of appeal rights.
Status conference on July 5, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Leila Onofre Horowitz in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In negotations, schedule @ 60 days out. State requests matter be scheduled sooner.  Status conference scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 08:45 am.
Defendant released on $5000 Signature Bond with monitored sobriety.
Status conference on May 23, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Jens H. Loberg has been retained by the defendant, in the above-reference matter.

Defendant Leila Onofre Horowitz in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Defendant Leila Onofre Horowitz in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court provides counsel and defendant with a copy of the Information; advises defendant of charge, maximum penalties.  Court with the consent of counsel and defendant uses the complaint in 16CF17 with the DA to supplement the record with the Information.  State informs of amendment to count 2 from expel urine to expel saliva.  Court advises defendant of charges/max penalties and advises defendant of her constitutional rights.  NGP entered all cases, all charges.  Atty Loberg addressed bond in 16CF20, requests reduced cash bond or convert to Signature Bond.  State notes safest place for Ms. Horowitz is where she is.  Court modifies bond to be $5000 cash or $5000 signature with conditions:  stay out of trouble; no drinking; monitored sobriety with twice a day testing; comply with treatment program; reside with Melissa Smith.

Defendant Leila Onofre Horowitz in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Defendant Leila Onofre Horowitz in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to a prelim. hrg. on record.  Court finds defendant's waiver of preliminary hearing done knowingly & voluntarily, binds defendant over for trial and accept Information for filing.  Atty Loberg notes their WOPH noted both cases 16CF20 and 16CF17.  Court shows WOPH on both cases.
J.M. is required to appear on 05/10/2016 at 1:15 pm
Preliminary hearing on May 10, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Leila Onofre Horowitz in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Smith requests to be heard on bond before addressing preliminary hearing.  State informs 16CF17 court set $5000 signature bond, 2nd case 16CF20 court set $5000 cash bond and left the $5000 signature bond on 1st case.  State doesn't object to reduced bond amount if conditions set to protect the public 1)defendant on alcohol monitor; 2)defendant remain faithful in treatment or counseling having now; best place is in jail on $5000 cash bond.  Atty Smith requests signature bond, cash bond not warranted.  Court notes the violation of signature bond, she was drinking, charged with OWI and felony bail jumping.  Bond remains as previously set.  Advised of right to P.H.  Defendant requests P.H. on 2nd case.  Counsel referred to scheduling clerk to schedule P.H. within 10 days.

No possession or consumption of alcohol.
If bond is posted Defendant must be on alcohol monitoring.

Defendant Leila Onofre Horowitz in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA reviews charges and max penalties, she was on a bond on case 2016CF17 with one condition being she not drink. Court advises defendant of rights including the right to a preliminary hearing within 10 days if in custody and 20 days if not.  State asked the court to change the bond in 2016CF17 from a $5,000.00 signature bond to a $5,000.00 cash bond lump together with bail jumping. Defendant addresses bond. Court asked the DA to speak with the Department of Human Services and sets a $5,000.00 cash Bond on the current charge, leave the other one alone, no counsel present and is not on the calendar. State asked for Alcohol Monitoring if the $5,000.00 bond is posted. Court agrees. Conditions of Bond: no possession or consumption of alcohol; if bond is posted must be on a alcohol monitoring.  Defendant to contact SPS office. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
